discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Ans: C
"In SharePoint in Microsoft 365, items are retained for 93 days from the time you delete them from their original location"

Answer : C
Till June 2 
unless someone deletes them from there or empties that Recycle Bin. In that case, the items go to the site collection Recycle Bin, where they stay for the remainder of the 93 days unless:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/restore-deleted-items-from-the-site-collection-recycle-bin-5fa924ee-16d7-487b-9a0a-021b9062d14b

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1.

On March 1, you delete a document named Document1.docx from Site1.

On April 1, you empty the Recycle Bin of Site1.

You need to identify the latest date a user who has the SharePoint admin role can recover Document1.docx.

Which date should you identify?

comments.content:
But should not your answers be exchanged?
- Admin is assigned E5 so it should be 365 days for answer 1
- The other as per policy should be 180 days for answer 2
Okay, in this case, it's 180 and 90 days. thanks for sharing.

Ok, double checked now and answer here should be correct because admin2 doesn't have E5 license.
Answer1 6 months
Answer 2 90 days

The default audit log retention policy only applies to audit records for activity performed by users who are assigned an Office 365 or Microsoft 365 E5 license or have a Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance or E5 eDiscovery and Audit add-on license. If you have non-E5 users or guest users in your organization, their corresponding audit records are retained for 90 days.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/audit-log-retention-policies?view=o365-worldwide
I believe you are correct, E5 is 365 days while E3 is 90 days.

"To retain an audit log for longer than 90 days (and up to 1 year), the user who generates the audit log (by performing an audited activity) must be assigned an Office 365 E5 or Microsoft 365 E5 license or have a Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance or E5 eDiscovery and Audit add-on license. To retain audit logs for 10 years, the user who generates the audit log must also be assigned a 10-year audit log retention add-on license in addition to an E5 license."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/audit-log-retention-policies?view=o365-worldwide#before-you-create-an-audit-log-retention-policy

discussion.content:
Correct me if I am wrong but default should be 365 days so one year
Answer 1 6 months
Answer 2 1 year
Similar Exam Question 210:
https://pupuweb.com/microsoft-365-mobility-security-ms101-actual-exam-question-answer-dumps-3/

Answer is correct.
User 1 would normally be 365 due to E5 license, however policy reduces to 6 months.
User 2 does not have E5 license, so is limited to 90 days.

discussion.content:
If a user attempts to upload a document to a Microsoft SharePoint site, and the document contains one UK passport number, the document will be…
allowed — correct answer
blocked without warning
blocked, but the user can override the policy

If a user attempts to email 100 UK passport numbers to a user in the same company, the email message will be…
allowed
blocked without warning
blocked, but the user can override the policy — correct answer
Came in exam 27.07.2021

Admin pls correct the answer to
A: ALLOWED
B: BLOCK, but user can override
Was on exam 30.12.2022
Same Question in MS 100. The correct answer is Allowed and blocked (user can override)
Was in Exam today 20 Aug 2022
first one Allowed, second one blocked but user can override

1. Allowed
2. Blocked with override

Correct Answer:
Allowed.
Blocked but User can override the policy.
In exam 6/4/22

Came on exam 09-05-2022
1. Allowed (nothing in the exhibit tells it has to block a single passport number)
2. Blocked, but the user can override the policy. (see settings where the override is set)

The document will be blocked if there are 10 or more instances of the same type of sensitive information. For part 1, there is only 1 instance of the same type of senstive information.

100 passport numbers will be blocked as there are more than 10 instances of sensitive data, however the user will be able to override this.

Therefore:
1. Allowed.
2. Blocked, but the user can override the policy.
still valid, it was in my exam last Feb 5, 2022

Admin, please correct the answer, the correct answers are 1. allowed 2. blocked, but the user can override the policy
